document_title: Acute pancreatitis: causes, symptoms, complications and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Pancreatitis can cause serious complications, including:
Kidney failure: Acute pancreatitis can cause severe kidney failure, sometimes even requiring dialysis. Lung damage: Acute pancreatitis causes biochemical changes in the body, affecting gas exchange in the lungs, causing hypoxia. Infection: a serious complication with a high mortality rate is infectious necrotizing pancreatitis Pancreatic pseudocyst: Acute pancreatitis can cause fluid and debris to accumulate in cyst-like sacs in the pancreas. A large pseudocyst that ruptures can cause complications such as bleeding and infection. Malnutrition: When inflamed, the pancreas produces less necessary enzymes. This can cause people to suffer from malnutrition, diarrhea and weight loss. Chronic pancreatitis: Repeated acute pancreatitis can lead to chronic pancreatitis.
